page.title: 10CHURCHES NR.WIDEGATES
page.content: St.Ann's Church,Hessenford,was built in 1832.It was taken down in 1870 and rebuilt in 1871.Local stone was used. Bath stone was used on the arches.This is crumbling.Long eared bats live in the roof.It costs Â£40 a week to run the church. The Methedist chapel was built in 1860.It's roof is in a poor state of repair needing Â£2,000 to renew the plaster on the walls and ceiling.The committee have tried to claim insurrance as the many heavy lorries that passed while the building of a large holiday complex caused much vibration.The claim was not granted. Â£100 has been raised so far.The chapel has little future. Widegates Methodist Church was built in 1878,the Sunday School was added in 1924
